name: Matt Culpepper
tagline: web developer and clean code evangelist
body:
## Contact Info

**phone:** `504.444.8413`  
**email:** `matt@culpepper.co`

## Skills

- **Ruby / Ruby on Rails**
- **JavaScript / jQuery / CoffeeScript**
- **HTML / CSS / Sass / Less**
- **PHP**
- **Shell**
- **Java**

## Experience

### TurboSquid (April 2013 - Oct 2014)
### _Senior Developer_

At [TurboSquid](https://turbosquid.com), my title was Senior Developer and my responsibilities included design, creation, and maintenance of internal projects created to manage 3D assets in the TurboSquid system. I refactored several internal applications for better maintainability and performance.

### Connect for a Cause (August 2012 - April 2013)
### _CTO / Co-Founder_

At [Connect for a Cause](https://connectforacause.com), as CTO, I was in charge of all technology and architectural decisions. I wrote all of the server-side Rails code and most of the JavaScript. I interviewed, selected, and managed a front-end contractor who helped with UI and usability.

### iSeatz (April 2010 - August 2012)
### _Developer II, Rails Lead_

At [iSeatz](http://www.iseatz.com), I went through several titles and responsibilities, but one of the most rewarding was when I was lead Rails developer on [American Express travel site](http://travel.americanexpress.com). I was in charge of the initial design of a Rails template engine that consumed iSeatz' internal API and consumed several external American Express membership and loyalty rewards APIs. I led teams ranging from 3 to 8 developers throughout my last year at iSeatz.

### University of Southern Mississippi (July 2009 - April 2010)
### _Senior Software Developer II_

At the [University of Southern Mississippi](http://www.usm.edu), I met with professors and other administrators on campus to get requirements and implemented these requirements using MSSQL and PHP. 

### BearingPoint (June 2007 - July 2009)
### _Application Developer II_

Introduced to several new technologies, such as IBM Rational, EJB, Message Queues, WebSphere, WebLogic, SVN, Serena PVCS, Spring, Struts, Hibernate, Oracle, Luntbuild and Cruise Control.

## Education
### Mississippi State University (2002 - 2006)
### _B.S., Computer Science_

## Other
### Sun Certified Java Programmer
### [Member of 2012 Silicon Bayou 100 List](http://siliconbayounews.com/2012/12/28/2012-sbn-100-group-7/)
